duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide advice and consultation to department staff to ensure a safe working environment in compliance with Safety & Environment regulations.
Participate in risk assessment/analysis, incident investigation, and root cause analysis.
Develop new Safety Procedures and revise existing procedures.
Maintain an understanding of current international legislation and industry best practices.
Analyze department’s safety statistics & develop specific HSE strategies to improve department safety performance.
Conduct HSE audits of company facilities, work locations, and contractor companies’ camps.
Act as an HSE mentor/coach to department personnel.
Provide the required HSE expertise and knowledge to develop, roll out, and implement the Company Safety Management System.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Safety Engineering or Science from an accredited University. (Master's preferred)
Professional Occupational Safety accreditation with NEBOSH IGC/Oil & Gas or equivalent.
Accident investigations and Root Cause Analysis Certification.
